alert.note: Alert for Prince of Wales Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 24 at 10:10AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The following area, Prince of Wales. * WHEN...Until 600 PM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1004 AM AKST, River gauge reports from the Thorne River continue to indicate that the river is near minor flood stage. Minor flooding is expected into the afternoon today before river levels fall this evening. - For Thorne River near Thorne Bay: At 9:00am the stage was 12.3 feet. Flood Stage is 12.5 feet. Impacts: At 12.5 feet: Water will begin to flow over the road upstream from the Thorne River bridge. - If you live near or along the Thorne River, stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
